original: Bergenholm, Karl Hjalmar, bankkamrer, kapten, Varberg, f. 12/10/91 i Maria förs. i Sthlm. G. 23 m. Ewa Peterson. Bank 16-18, dito i A-B Sv. Lantmännens Bank 18-20, förest, f. rev:avd. där 20-21, kamr. v. kont. i Linköp. 21-23, kamr. i A-B Jordbr :-banken i Linköp, 23-35, kamr. o. kont: förest, v. Jordbr :banken i Var-berg sed. 35. Rev. i östergötl. 1. landstin|g 28-35, ordf. i Varbergs fas-tigh:fören. 41-46, rev. av Varbergs stads räkensk. o. förvaltn. sed. 38, ÖA^erförmynd. i Varberg sed. 45, av Västergötl, o. N. translated: Bergenholm, Karl Hjalmar, bank clerk, captain, Varberg, b. 12/10/91 in Maria parish in Stockholm. Married in 1923 to Ewa Peterson. Children: Sven-Olof b. 1924, Britt-Marie b. 1925, Per-Erik b. 1929. Studied at Karlstad  Gymnasium with graduation in 1911, and military officer training in 1915. Commissioned as a second lieutenant in the Werml Regiment in 1915, promoted to first lieutenant in 1918, and to captain in 1932. Worked at Werm-landis Ensk. Bank from 1916 to 1918, and then at A-B Sv. Lantmännens Bank from 1918 to 1920. Became head of the audit department at A-B Sv. Lantmännens Bank in 1920 and later worked as an accountant officer at a branch office in Linköping from 1921 to 1923, and as an accountant for A-B Jordbråksbanken in Linköping from 1923 to 1935. From 1935, was the branch manager and accountant for the Jordbråksbanken in Varberg. He served as a member of the Eastern Göteborg Landsting from 1928 to 1935, chairman of the Varberg Property Association from 1941 to 1946, auditor of the Varberg City Accounts and Administration since 1938, and overseer of Varberg since 1945. He was also approved as an auditor by the Chamber of Commerce for Western Göteborg and Northern Halland in 1936. He was also a member of the Freemason Order.
